results.title: Pharmacokinetics of enalapril and lisinopril in subjects with normal and impaired hepatic function.
results.text_hl: Pharmacokinetics of @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in subjects with normal and @<m>DISEASE_Liver_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008107 @@@impaired hepatic function@@@.

citations.NLM: Hayes PC, Plevris JN, Bouchier IA. Pharmacokinetics of enalapril and lisinopril in subjects with normal and impaired hepatic function. J Hum Hypertens. 1989 Jun;3 Suppl 1():153-8. PMID: 2550638

results.title: Pharmacologic, pharmacokinetic, and therapeutic differences among ACE inhibitors.
results.text_hl: For @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with severe @<m>DISEASE_Liver_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008107 @@@liver disease@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ are not prodrugs (e.g., do not require hepatic activation), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ has almost solely renal elimination.

citations.NLM: White CM. Pharmacologic, pharmacokinetic, and therapeutic differences among ACE inhibitors. Pharmacotherapy. 1998 May-Jun;18(3):588-99. PMID: 9620109
citations.BibTeX: @article{9620109, title={Pharmacologic, pharmacokinetic, and therapeutic differences among ACE inhibitors.}, author={White CM}, journal={Pharmacotherapy}, volume={18}, number={3}, pages={588-99}}
